article.headline: New Hampshire 91, Suffolk 45
article.story: DURHAM, N.H. -- Dane DiLiegro scored 14 points and grabbed 15 rebounds in New Hampshire's 91-45 win over Suffolk on Saturday night. DiLiegro led five Wildcats in double figures as Chandler Rhoads scored 14, Alvin Abreu 12, Tyrone Conley 11 and Colbey Santos added 10. Rhoads also had four steals and Abreu added seven assists. New Hampshire took a 12-4 lead on two free throws by Abreu and didn't look back the rest of the way in its season opener. The Wildcats shot 51.7 percent from the field in the second half (15 of 29), while the Rams shot just 24.2 percent in the half (8 of 33). New Hampshire was 8 of 12 from 3-point range (36.4 percent), including two long-range shots by Radar Onguetou. Karl Busch scored 10 points for the Rams in their fourth straight loss to New Hampshire.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
